vstore.framework

Class VStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • vstore.framework.VStore

  • public class VStore
extends java.lang.Object
    Main entry point for the vStore virtual storage framework. The application is in charge of providing new context and connectivity information to enable the framework to stay up to date.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static VStore mInstance
      This field contains the framework instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VStore

        private VStore(java.io.File baseDir,
               java.net.URL masterNodeAddress)
        throws VStoreException
        Private constructor for creating a new VStore object. It initializes all components necessary for operation of the framework (VStoreConfig, DBHelper).
        Parameters:
        baseDir - The root directory for the framework data.
        masterNodeAddress - The address of the master node.
        Throws:
        VStoreException - in case an error occurred.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.io.File baseDir,
                              java.net.URL masterNodeAddress)
                       throws VStoreException
        Initializes the vStore framework.
        Parameters:
        baseDir - The root directory for the framework data.
        masterNodeAddress - The address of the master node.
        Throws:
        VStoreException - In case some error occurred during instantiation.

      • getInstance

        public static VStore getInstance()
        Gets the instance of the vStore framework.
        Returns:
        The instance of vStore framework.

      • getConfigManager

        public ConfigManager getConfigManager()
        Returns the current configuration containing application-defined settings. To refresh / re-download the configuration, call ConfigManager.download(boolean)
        Returns:
        The VStoreConfig configuration object. Will return the default configuration, if you have not configured anything.

      • getFileManager

        public FileManager getFileManager()
        Returns:
        The file manager object for file handling.

      • getCommunicationManager

        public CommunicationManager getCommunicationManager()
        Returns:
        The communication manager can be used for operations regarding up- and downloads.

      • getRuleManager

        public RuleManager getRuleManager()
        Returns:
        The rule manager can be used to manage the creation and deletion of rules.

      • getContextManager

        public ContextManager getContextManager()
        Returns:
        The context manager can be used for operations regarding context.

      • getNodeManager

        public NodeManager getNodeManager()
        Returns:
        The storage node manager can be used for operations regarding storage nodes.

      • getCurrentContext

        public ContextDescription getCurrentContext()
        This method returns the usage context currently used for matching. If you want to refresh it, use provideContext(ContextDescription)
        Returns:
        A ContextDescription-object containing the current usage context description

      • provideContext

        public ContextManager provideContext(ContextDescription ctxDescription)
        Use this method to provide new context information to the framework. If the new information should be persistent after a restart of the framework, persistContext(boolean) should be called.
        Parameters:
        ctxDescription - The new context information
        Returns:
        Returns the context manager instance again to simplify method-chaining.

      • persistContext

        public ContextManager persistContext(boolean makePersistent)
        Use this method to make the currently configured usage context persistent after a restart of the framework.
        Parameters:
        makePersistent - True if the context should be persistent. False if you want to undo this.
        Returns:
        Returns the context manager instance again to simplify method-chaining.

      • clearCurrentContext

        public ContextManager clearCurrentContext()
        This method clears the current usage context and resets it to an empty state.
        Returns:
        Returns the context manager instance again to simplify method-chaining.

      • clearRules

        public RuleManager clearRules()
        This method clears all rules and resets the rule set to an empty state.
        Returns:
        Returns the rule manager instance again to simplify method-chaining.

      • store

        public VStoreFile store(java.lang.String fileUri,
                        boolean isPrivate)
                 throws StoreException
        Stores a file in the virtual storage framework. A unique file ID will be returned immediately and the upload to a storage node will continue in the background.
        Parameters:
        fileUri - The absolute path to the file to upload, including the filename. The URI must be a valid path to a file.
        isPrivate - Specify whether the file should be publicly available or if it is a personal file that should remain private. True = private, False = public
        Returns:
        Returns "null" if an error occurred. Returns a unique identifier if all went well. For a list of supported file types see the class VFileType.java. Other file types will be handled without any matching rules.
        Throws:
        StoreException - in case something failed.

      • getFilesMatchingContext

        public boolean getFilesMatchingContext(ContextDescription usageContext,
                                       ContextFilter filter,
                                       java.lang.String requestId)
        This method starts a job that queries every available storage node with the given usage context. The nodes will then deliver a list with files matching this context. You can subscribe to the following event to get notified of available results from a node: NewFilesMatchingContextEvent To request files for a custom context, simply create a ContextDescription with the desired properties and pass it to this method.
        Parameters:
        usageContext - The usage context for which to find matching files.
        filter - A filter that should be applied to the context.
        requestId - Give your request an ID so that you can keep track of the replies when they come in with the event.
        Returns:
        True, if the request jobs have been started. Returns false, if not.

      • getFilesUploadedByThisDevice

        public void getFilesUploadedByThisDevice(DBResultOrdering ordering,
                                         boolean onlyPending,
                                         boolean onlyPrivate)
        Can be used to fetch a list of all files uploaded (or currently uploading) from this device. Results are published in the FilesReadyEvent.
        Parameters:
        ordering - The order in which to fetch the files. (see DBResultOrdering).
        onlyPending - If true, only files that are pending to upload will be returned.
        onlyPrivate - If true, only files that are marked private will be returned.

      • getFile

        public void getFile(java.lang.String uuid,
                    java.io.File dir)
        Use this method to request the full file that has the given UUID. Subscribe to the event DownloadProgressEvent to get notified about the state of the request for this file UUID. Additionally, listen to the DownloadFailedEvent to get notified if a file download failed. When the download is ready, you will be notified by the DownloadedFileReadyEvent.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The uuid of the file to retrieve.
        dir - If specified, the file will be placed in this directory.

      • getThumbnail

        public void getThumbnail(java.lang.String fileUuid)
        Loads the thumbnail for the given UUID. Thumbnail will be returned in the NewThumbnailEvent.
        Parameters:
        fileUuid - The UUID of the file.

      • isMyFile

        public boolean isMyFile(java.lang.String fileUuid)
        Checks if the file with the given UUID was published before by this device.
        Parameters:
        fileUuid - The UUID to check
        Returns:
        True, if this phone uploaded the file.

      • deleteFile

        public boolean deleteFile(java.lang.String fileUuid)
        Marks the given file for deletion. Once the corresponding node has replied that the file was deleted, you will be notified of the success with the following event: FileDeletedEvent
        Parameters:
        fileUuid - The UUID of the file to delete.
        Returns:
        True when the file was marked for deletion locally and the deletion has started.

      • isMimeTypeSupported

        public static boolean isMimeTypeSupported(java.lang.String mimetype)
        This method checks, if the given string is a mime type supported by the framework. For supported types see VFileType.
        Parameters:
        mimetype - The mime type string, e.g. "image/jpeg".
        Returns:
        True, if the type is supported. False, if not.

      • getDeviceIdentifier

        public static java.lang.String getDeviceIdentifier()
        Returns:
        The identifier of this device.

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Call this when you exit your application to clean up any mess.
